拼.definition: to piece together; to put together; to pool (resources etc); to share; to risk all; to go all out; to spell (words)

拼到底.definition: to brave it out; to the bitter end

拼卡.definition: to share a card with sb (e.g. share a loyalty card to accumulate points and split the benefits)

拼合.definition: to fit together; to put together

拼命.definition: to do one's utmost; with all one's might; at all costs; (to work or fight) as if one's life depends on it

拼命三郎.definition: brave man, willing to risk his life

拼命討好.definition: to throw oneself at sb or sth; to bend over backwards to help

拼圖.definition: jigsaw puzzle; to do a jigsaw puzzle

拼多多.definition: Pinduoduo, social e-commerce company founded in 2015

拼婚.definition: to save money on wedding expenses by getting together with another couple (or couples) in arranging restaurant reservations, wedding photo shoots etc

拼客.definition: person who joins with others to reduce costs (carpooling, group buying, sharing an apartment etc)

拼成.definition: to put sth together from component parts

拼房.definition: to rent a place with sb else to share the costs

拼搶.definition: to fight desperately (at the risk of one's life)

拼板.definition: to edge-join boards with glue to form a panel (woodworking)

拼桌.definition: to sit at a table with others with whom one is unacquainted

拼死.definition: to go all out for sth at risk of one's life

拼死拼活.definition: one's utmost; (to fight or work) desperately hard; to put up a life or death struggle; at all costs

拼殺.definition: to grapple (with the enemy); to fight at the risk of one's life

拼爹.definition: (slang) to rely on one's father's wealth or prestige to get ahead

拼版.definition: to typeset; to make up (printers' plates)

拼讀.definition: to pronounce a word after mentally processing its spelling; (phonics) blending

拼錯.definition: to misspell; to piece together incorrectly

拼餐.definition: (of people with tight budget) to enjoy various dishes at the restaurant by ordering the food together and then sharing the costs
